dataStructure.name: sid.org.tmforum.tip.resource.res.log.tip.nrf.TopologicalLink
dataStructure.description:
This object class represents a physical link between two or more (usual case two; more than two e.g., for representing RPR transport connectivity) PTPs or a trail between two TPs. A Topological Link (TL) may traverse through DWDM equipment and optical transport networks managed by another target OS. The TL reported by the first target OS in that case could correspond to a (regenerator) section under its management domain. It is up to the requesting OS user to put together the exact topology of the network in such cases, based on the reported Managed Elements and TLs. For unidirectional TLs the aEndTP marks the traffic source whereas the zEndTP marks the traffic sink. See R_TMF518_NRF_I_0019 and R_TMF518_NRF_I_0020.

This entity is optional

This entity is extendable

This entity generates Object Creation notifications

This entity generates Object Deletion notifications

This entity generates Object Discovery notifications

This entity generates Attribute Value Change notifications.
dataStructure.label: TopologicalLink

child.name: direction
child.description:
This attribute identifies the direction of the Topological Link.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is invariant

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC disabled
child.label: direction

child.name: ituArcStateAndStatusList
child.description:
See R_TMF518_NRB_I_0001 and R_TMF518_NRB_I_0004. See supporting document SD1-8_encodingX731M3100

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: ituArcStateAndStatusList

child.name: isReportingAlarms
child.description:
This attribute provides an indication of whether alarm reporting for this Topological Link is administratively activated or de-activated. True = alarm reporting is activated; False = alarm reporting is de-activated.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: isReportingAlarms

child.name: layerRate
child.description:
This attribute identifies the layer and bandwidth (rate) of the Topological Link (TL). The Layer Rate of a TL is determined by the lowest common Layer Rate of the end point TPs, about which the target OS has knowledge (with the physical layer being the very lowest).

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is invariant

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC disabled
child.label: layerRate

child.name: aEndTpRefList

This association end is unique

This association end is passed by id

This association end is optional

This association end is AVC disabled
child.label: aEndTpRefList

child.name: zEndTpRefList
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity *

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is unique

This association end is an end of association TlIsTerminatedByZEndTps

This association end is passed by id

This association end is optional

This association end is AVC disabled
child.label: zEndTpRefList

child.name: asapRef
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity 0..1

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is unique

This association end is an end of association TopologicalLinkHas

This association end is optional
child.label: asapRef
